summary: Max Mercer is a mischievous and resourceful young boy who has been left behind while his family is in Japan for the holidays. So when a married couple attempting to retrieve a priceless heirloom set their sights on the Mercer family's home, it is up to Max to protect it from the trespassers... and he will do whatever it takes to keep them out. Hilarious hijinks of epic proportions ensue, but despite the absolute chaos, Max comes to realize that there really is no place like home sweet home.

reviews.content: This feels as if it's trying to knock off the holiday classic we all know and love. This feels nothing like a home alone movie, yes the plot that hasn't been changed since Home Alone 2 were Kevin is alone in New York, and it goes back to the bland plot of Home alone 1,3,4. Awful movie

Disney: I NEED MONEY!
Disney: Home alone 6
Guy: Yes, make Home alone 6
Disney: Yea I hope guys give me Money from Disney+ subscription!
Disney made Home alone 6 because Money.

Bad I watch this with my son because I thought I was good having the franchise back but the film is just horrible the real villain is the boy max who is left home alone and the robbers who aren't even robbers are just a family who has a very hard time going through with their life and the director of this awful film thought he could describe both home alone 1 and home alone 4 together into one film and also this film was so bad my son hated it too
Home Sweet Home Alone has Disney's quality leave home for the worst, with a terrible misunderstanding of the original classic and. A money-driven
This movie is boring without the charm that made the first two so great, the fact that the villains aren't actually villains makes this movie even worse.
Nonsensical mess of a cash grab.

The movie was funny. It would have been better not as a Home Alone movie though. The kid was the true villain in this one. The movie would have worked better if it just focused on Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney. Worth a watch.
Bullshit! It's on e of the worst movies I've ever seen. Lame plot. Bad acting. Mean characters. 0 stars

i only signed up for rotten tomatoes to absolutely SLANDER this movie. forget about my rating being rotten, the main character is. whatever the boy's name is, is an absolute psychopath. WHO RAISED HIM?! home alone is supposed to be a movie where the bad guys (robbers) are actually bad guys. you cant do anything but feel bad for the couple who needs the "stolen" doll to support their family and prevent them from from moving due to financial problems. we're supposed to be on the main character's side because they're an innocent child who is in danger. the kid who's home alone is such a brat, whiny and all. the end is not sweet like the original home alone at all. last but not least, he leaves their family's house a complete disaster not to mention, the so-called bad guys. the movie's so corny and the jokes don't make sense. the references? nobody knows them--besides the Kevin McCallister one. overall, the movie is a disaster. the ending did it for me though, it was a nice reunion but how could this murder-attempted child bring two family's together? this movie getting a 0.5 rating is more than a Christmas miracle. you can call me the grinch for all i care.

An obvious cash-in from Disney who are essentially saying "we miss making DTV sequels" but targeting Fox IPs instead, Home Sweet Home Alone is a low point for a franchise whose only good entries are the ones that had the actual cast and crew from 1990 involved. Rehashing all the tropes with none of the substance and made even worse by the fact that our protagonist is an insufferable prick and the "villains" have a very sympathetic motive that just makes their alleged comeuppance feel horrifying or depressing. It maybe would've worked better had their motives been a plot twist but, thanks to fourth wall myopia, I'm instead baffled why Disney wants me to laugh at these antics. At least it was nice to see Buzz again, though. I would rather sit through the atrocious Buck Wild movie a second time than see this Christmas "treat" that will make anybody on Santa's naughty list wish they got coal.
Truly one of the very worst films ever made. I cannot believe Disney are still showing it. The main character is beyond unlikeable and the "villains" are the ones deserving sympathy.
This movie was worse than home alone 4 and you can't change my mind
Horrible, horrible movie. It really tries to punish the “robbers” even thought they’re intentions are for good. The kid should be the one getting his ass beat, not them.
A laughable recreation of a holiday classic, Home Sweet Home Alone falls flat on its face by making the protagonist a one-dimensional villain.
The storyline was awful, the cast was completely out of place and the cameo from the original was weak.
Pretty bad not gonna lie
It was so funny! 10/10
Once I saw Kevin I just hated the movie
This movie is so bad it made me wish the robbers came armed.

Sometimes when a movie is horrible, I will put in the effort to write a review on Rotten Tomatoes, but this movie was so mind-numbingly terrible, I can't even be bothered to say anything about it. It's nonexistent to me. That's how little I care about it and the characters.
I've never seen a film as bad as this. No one can act and it has shamed the first 2 Home Alones
Chill out everyone. This was a fun Christmas romp
This makes me think of Home Alone 1, 2 and 3... Because this movie is exactly as terrible as those movies were great.
Terrible. Not funny at all

It's about the worst movie I've seen in a long time. I created an entire account just for this review. The plot is a brat little kid stealing from a family down and out financially. What he stole could save the family their home full of memories but he would rather be scum and assault them while committing grand theft. Whoever created this movie has hopefully retired and picked up a new career in something their more suited for, like glue merchandising.
While the story/premise are ridiculous the protagonist is so unlikeable the movie is unwatchable.
bad, i really hate this movie
Did Disney make a horrible movie on purpose?? How can you take an iconic brand like Home Alone and make such junk? You almost have to try to screw it up this bad.
It was cool seeing Buzz back
he looks like cale. it scarred me for life.

This movie was such a disappointment - maybe the worse sequel in the series, yet. Did not honor the legacy of the classics in any way shape or form! The storyline is ridiculous and incoherent. No effort went into it. Don’t waste the time. Bad guys were not even really bad, per se. 👎🏻

As someone who watched the original home alone I found this to be an utter disgrace to everything that home alone was the protagonist is a selfish jerk, the "villains "are not evil and most of the time the protagonist does most of the attempted murder in the end this is a terrible movie to show your kids.

It doesn’t bother to try and make the kid likable until the end. Plus you feel sorry for the crooks since they aren’t crooks. They just want something back that they think he took. So who do you root for ?

If anyone has seen the other home alone reboots you'd be expecting this one to be the same as them. A disgrace to have the name home alone and a pretty bad movie but this movie actually suprised me. Yes, it was not the best and definetly doesn't compare to the originals but as its own thing it's pretty good. The movie even refernces this with a character saying that people shouldn't remake the classics. In the movie I liked the special appearance of Devin Ratray that played Buzz in the Original movies. Also liked the character of Pam McKenzie which was played by Ellie Kemper who also played Erin Hannon in the American mockumentary sitcom The Office.
What a waste of time. Why give sob story to the supposed "villain", and the main character is not a good kid either. Mehh..
This is easily the worst home alone movie and one of the the worst movies that I've seen. At least space jam 2 is funny bad, this is awful bad.

This movie is horrendous. no plot, awful acting, stupid characters, the jokes are so unfunny, 1 scene that they mock the viewers, the traps are bad, the burglas didn't deserve to be punished, it ruins what makes home alone a great film, The only good scene about this film is buzz mccallister, but everything is so stupid, nothing make sense in this film, and it has no bad guy in the movie, WHICH RUINS THE POINT OF HOME ALONE !!!!!! 😡🤬😡🤬😡🤬 0/10
2nd to worst home alone (the worst is home alone 5)
It's like a painstaking game of telephone...now including a toddler. What did she say? Ok, write that.

Can we please just stop making Home Alone sequels. The Terminator franchise seems to gets alot of crap for having the most unnecessary sequels after the first 2 movies. In my opinion, the Terminator sequels look like masterpieces compared to the Home Alone sequels. Id say the Home Alone franchise has had the worse and most unnecessary sequels after the first 2 movies. My 1 and only positive i can give this movie, is at least it's not the worse Home Alone movie. That honor goes to Home Alone 4.
best home alone movie

.5 out of 5 stars. One of the worst films ever. First of all, the couple that was trying to break into the home was not really the bad guys. They were trying to claim a antique doll that was there. Except, the kid Max (Archie Yates) took from there house. It was difficult to even care for Max when he was annoying and more of the bad guy. The characters are unlikable. The script is annoying with cringy dialogue. The humor is stupid. Lacks the fun the other films had. And there was not one good thing about the film.
With a ridiculous story and an obnoxious main character who's harder to root for than the "villains," Home Sweet Home Alone is no fun for the whole family.

When compared to 3,4 and 5, this one is a masterpiece. Compare it to 1 and 2, it's the biggest pile of rubbish you could imagine. The acting is shockingly bad and the burglars are portrayed really dumb.
This movie is orrible

Just Bad, The story just like original but the bad guys gets a plot and they are actually good and the whole traps are because of misunderstanding and for dumb reasons with it the fart jokes and mordern setting with social media with cringe stuff, only last 20mins were decent and overall movie is a dissapointment.

If I could give this film zero stars I would. There is one enjoyable joke within the first 10 minutes of the film, and that was it. I'd rather lick a cactus than watch this again. I have near zero film making experience and. I could make a better Home Alone movie for 1% of the budget of this disaster.
Better then the 4th and 5th but thats not hard to do. This movie still sucked. Everything sucked. The only good thing about it was the scene with Buzz.

Maybe the worst movie I have ever seen. It’s not even worth going into everything but in a nutshell - the worst conceived plot, jokes that don’t land, and funny actors who were wasted on one of the laziest, dumbest, unfunny scripts ever. I would give it -5 stars if I could.

WHAT. A. MESS. Archie Yates is of course good in the role of Max, or at least as good as you can be with such a weak script, but there's no denying how much of a train wreck this is. Aisling Bea's accent is painful to listen to, the villains are the star of this movie for some reason, and some of the dialogue here is so awful that it makes me feel as though Hollywood is forever doomed. And they just had to sneak in Kevin's brother to remind that there are other, watchable Home Alone movies out there. The Christmas music and set design is beautiful though, to be fair.

Despite Ellie Kemper's and Rob Delaney's performances, I'm not entirely sure what Home Sweet Home Alone's concept is trying to tell and whether I should sympathise more with the villains or its underwhelming main character.

I remember watching the original Home Alone in theaters as a kid. I don't think anyone thought at the time Home Alone would begin a franchise that would last so long. I think the  great writing of John Hughes has a lot to do with this. Home Sweet Home Alone tries to capture the same magic as Home Alone, and lacks a few things that made the original special. The story here is fresh and needs a little improvement. The characters are original and are not as interesting as the first Home Alone. A few simple changes would go a very long way.



The story is interesting and simple, which I really like. Max is left home alone after his entire family leaves for the holidays. The house, of course, is chaotic, since it's filled with so many people, and the family is in a rush to leave. Pam and Jeff are a married couple who live close by and are in a bad financial situation after Jeff lost his job earlier in the year. While trying to sell their house before they lose it, Jeff realized that one of his old family dolls is worth a lot of money, like $200,000. Only the doll has gone missing during an open house, and he has to steal it back. I like the premise. The details I don't like. Home Sweet Home Alone is not going to become a Christmas classic like the original, however, this movie is not nearly as bad as everyone says it is.



The biggest problem of the story happens at the very beginning of the movie. Max and his mom are driving home and Max needs to use a bathroom… like, now. So his mom stops at an open house, because, I guess that's what you do when you have to go. After a brief introduction of our soon to be thieves and a brief altercation between Max and Jeff, we're left with the impression that Max stole a very rare and valuable doll. This immediately turns Max into the bad guy of the movie, when he really should be the hero. 



Although Home Sweet Home Alone is a very funny movie, the premise isn't that good. Really, the story is disappointing. A couple who had their doll stolen is trying to steal back a doll that belongs to them. The bad guys are really the victims in the story. A better idea would be to keep them as bad guys by stealing a doll that belongs to the boy who is left home alone.



My storyline would go something like this. The Max's family is having an open house. The thieves attend the open house looking for things to steal and find a doll that they know is worth a lot of money. Overhearing a conversation, they learn the home owners are going away for Christmas and plan on coming back after they leave. Then when the thieves come back, they encounter Max left home alone. This way, the bad guys are bad guys and the boy is the hero.



Another thing I would change is how bratty Max is. The kid is a real spoiled brat. He doesn't come across as likable at all. Kevin, from the original Home Alone, wasn't a perfect saint. And he was at least likable. I'm sure the filmmakers were trying to get some cheap laughs by having a smart alec boy mouthing off. However, this doesn't really work. Max shouldn't be a brat. We need to want him to be a hero in the story for this to work. Max really needs some discipline from his father.



Which reminds me… where is his father? Max talks about his parents all the time in the movie, and we never see the dad. Just the mom… and, well, we see a lot of people around the house in the beginning. The house is so full of people that Max feels the need to hide in the BMW parked in the garage to get some peace and quiet. And we have no idea who these people are. Just that all of them are on their way overseas for the holidays. Some have English accents. Some have American accents… no idea what the relation is between everyone. A couple of quick scenes at the beginning to introduce everyone would clear this up.

HORRIFIC! Honestly watching this makes my brain hurt.
While not the most "enjoyable flim", I will say this… the ending of Max and his mom is to me, at least decent.

Oof. 
Did not laugh once. The 'villans' couldn't take two steps without falling.  Definitely over did it on the slap-stick it's almost unbearable to watch.
I'm going to keep this short. I hate the movie. Hate the kid. Anyone who wrote, directed, or produced should not be aloud to ever again, or for at least a while.

Alright, I really don't know what y'all are talking about with all the hate on this one. The original Home Alone was poorly paced and the second one was too murderously violent for a kid's movie. This one forging a new path where there are jokes peppered into the exposition, the robbers aren't outright villains, their motives are understandable enough to kids and the violence is more cartoonish just makes this a more finely-tuned kids movie than any of its predecessors, at least the theatrically released ones. Sure, some of the dialogue was bad and I didn't much care for Buzz's cameo, but I thought the plot mechanics that kept the kid at home by himself were more believable than the original had been, where the mom has a serious argument with Macaulay and then forgets it completely by the next morning. The slapstick was creative and the boy was charismatic. I will note that my highly positive viewing experience was likely skewed upward by the absolute best fart joke I have ever seen in a movie. I'm not normally a fan of scatalogical humor, but oh my goodness, I was wheezing for a solid 5 minutes at the toot scene and as soon as my 8-year-old came home I had to pull the movie back up to show him. This was a real classic for me!

Ok everyone needs to chill out- this movie is very undeserving of all these low reviews. First of all the cast was amazing- so many big names in comedy and a buzz cameo (the excitement is setting aside what a piece of shit the actor turned out to be). 
My husband and I grew up in the 80's and of course were excited to share home alone with our 4 year old who of course loved the first two. She demanded to watch all of them- getting through 3 was slightly painful, 4 was an absolute train wreck so we were not looking forward to sitting through this one either. But we were laughing (genuinely) the whole time. Our daughter yes was confused and wanted a genuine bad guy but honestly the plot was refreshing and different enough to not just be another rehash. There were no real bad guys just a big misunderstanding followed by the obvious ensuing hijinks. We enjoyed it more than our daughter, even though she got the traps she craved so she liked it too, but for what it was it was great and would absolutely recommend.

"Home Sweet Home Alone" is a lazy rehash with just enough unique elements to past the piracy test. This film has no heart and no Christmas spirit to help out the horrid screenplay. The acting is subpar, Archie Yates is extremely unlikable, and the whole thing looks worse than your average Hallmark movie. Save yourself some time (and IQ points) and pass on this one. In fact, pass on each Home Alone iteration post "Lost in New York". Sure, that one was just a rehash as well, but at least it had personality and charm (and the lovely Culkin and Pesci combo). Home Sweet Home Alone has nothing—and when I mean nothing, I mean absolutely NOTHING.

Worst one so far. 
The burglers are the good guys, the Trap scene is short and painful to watch.
Good Lord this movie is absolutely terrible and really really bad movie.

This movie was horrific. It would probably fit better with the saw franchise, Watching this rich child rip into a poor struggling family with some of the most brutal traps in the whole series, including needle tipped nerf guns, and needle tipped security buttons, and shooting billiard balls at high speeds. This child comes across as a complete psycho and is honestly disturbing to watch. Don't show this to your kids, and if they laugh at it, please have them examined by a psychiatrist, this movie is messed up.
God, why did they rape the classics? This movie just doesn't make sense. This is a cruel, illogical and low-grade film.
This movie sucks, the writer/writers should be banned from writing. Way to ruin a classic, was the kid the villain in the movie?
Movies like this shouldn't exist
Painful to watch. Even sociopaths won't want to watch this movie.

There's a lot of hate for this film, which I don't understand. I'm a child of the 80s, and the original ‘Home Alone' was one of the first films I ever saw at the cinema. I loved it, and the (entirely predictable but brilliant) ‘Home Alone 2: Lost in New York' that followed. Both written by the 80's legend John Hughes. I've re-watched both many times, and was highly sceptical of this new edition. Every sequel there has been since the first two films has been terrible, but I was pleasantly surprised with this!

I think the acting is great, and the motivations of all individuals is largely logical (granted, at points that is a stretch). It's no more absurd than the original two (perhaps at points less so).

I was surprised it was still almost as jovially violent as the original, which added to the enjoyment - and there were many moments that made me laugh out loud. There is also some disguised adult humour, which I won't spoil by quoting here, particularly with the Smart-device in the home.

Great cameo from the actor who played Kevin's brother Buzz in the original too - and this wasn't just a nod, it actually significantly added to the panning out of the plot.

I'd recommend this film to all ages 😊
One of the worst movies I've ever seen. I was enough for 20 minutes of this horror...
This was the worst abomination ive have ever layed my eyes upom crank 90's on that hoe
this movie is so terrible that now i wanna slowly die in a ocean of pain and blood

The movie was funny. It would have been better not as a Home Alone movie though. The kid was the true villain in this one. The movie would have worked better if it just focused on Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney. Worth a watch.

The kid is a crappy little psychopath and I definitely relate way more to the lower middle class family. Are we supposed to hate the kid and love the burglars? It was so sad to watch this movie. I don't understand, like, is it supposed to be funny? Cuz watching this poor family get their shit rocked by a psychopathic rich kid wasn't funny at all. It just made me feel bad for them. Hated it. Would give 0 stars if I could.

Why would I sympathize with a rich asshole kid like the "protagonist"? This whole premise is just a chance for the 1% to laugh at the fact that the impoverished "villains" don't even have the life insurance to afford all of their injuries. I will remind you, injuries caused by a tiny, scrooge-like Ted Bundy-in-training.

Unless that was some weird, convoluted way of criticizing capitalism and class structure, I gott hand it to the writers, who wrote the worst, most obnoxious and unlikeable main character in the history of films, probably. So, congratulations to the writers and director, well done
no good, the bad guys are good, traps were kinda formulatic and was very unessary
Buzz was cool. Everything else sucks.

The kid is the villain in this one and the couple who try to break in the home are good people trying to save the house. You cannot root for the kid no chance he is a going to be a leading villain he just has mischief and evil written all over him
Complete waste of time. Horrible addition to the series.
The worst 30 minutes of my life. Couldn't watch longer. The remake is a total fail in terms of acting and plot.
You know, it's like picking up and old pair of dusty shoes. They still fit, if a bit awkwardly, but you know, the magic is still there. Even if it's only just a twinkle

This movie was so bad I had to make an account just to speak out against it. I made it 23 minutes into the movie before I had to turn it off and have a conversation with my son about it. The premise is horrible no matter what the ending is: a desperate couple, hard on their luck, attempt to break into a home to take back an heirloom they believe was stolen from them by a bratty, obnoxious rich kid. They're then terrorized by the rich kid who is left home alone. What kind of message is that sending? The optics are terrible. The franchise was better off when the bad guys were actual bad guys, not poor people trying desperately not to lose their home. I wish my kid had never seen this but I'm glad I watched it with him. Afterwards, I explained to him that being poor doesn't make people bad but that sometimes people to bad things when they are desperate. The moral of the story is you can't just take things that don't belong to you. If I could give this movie 0 stars I would. It doesn't deserve to bear the Home Alone name.

I saw the trailer and I immediately figured this would be just the same movie done almost exactly the same but with different characters, just like sequels 3 & 4. And honestly, that's exactly what this ended up being. Just a blatant cash grab with nothing to gain from seeing it. And like the other reviewers said, I wasn't rooting for a single character in this movie.
Put it on knowing it would be bad, but boyyyy is it bad. I was able to handle 20 minutes. The whole premise is terrible, they try to copy so much from Home Alone 1, and it's cringe at how they fail.

How could Disney allow this movie to happen?? After watching this movie I fully regret watching this. It's a true abomination. How could somebody make a movie this awful. It's like the writers and the actors were drunk while making this. This is the type of movie that destroys careers. I don't recommend this movie at all. This is the worst movie I've seen in a very very long time, probably years. Sitting though this movie is pure torture. This is the type of movie that would be good for interrogation because nobody can sit through this and will have to confess. In the end don't watch this, this movie is only good if your high out of your mind or drunk. If somebody actually enjoys this abomination I would like to talk to them to see what mental state they are in. This is pure awful. The worst of the worst.

This poor excuse for film is nothing more than an hour and 33 minutes of hot garbage. The emotions you would expect from a Christmas movie were non existent within my soul and only replaced by a burning hatred toward the excuse of a main character. The writers of this movie should never be able to write a movie ever again. They make the protagonist extremely unlikeable and the antagonist a family that is struggling financially. The ending doesn't even make sense and leaves the viewer extremely unsatisfied. I've read the 5 stars reviews and they claim that this movie is good because people are comparing it to the original film. Even if you don't compare this to the original the movie is still trash. If I was able to rate this 0 stars I would, but I can't so I give it a 1/5. Now I will rant about everything that is wrong with this film. The main characters family make me want to jump off a bridge into shark infested waters. When I saw them on the plane I literally saw a little devil on my left shoulder telling me to pray for their plane to crash in the pacific ocean. Then the angel appeared on my right and agreed. There is also no central character building in any portion of the film. There are absolutely no consequences for anyone's actions. The boy is a bratty little prick at the end, then craps himself when he realizes he doesn't know how to use a microwave and cry's for mommy. Speaking about the mom, she should never be allowed to have children ever again. She needs to learn that a belt to a cheek isn't going to end the world nor will it kill your child. All in all this is the worst movie I've ever been forced to watch. Even if the "robbers" were robber I would have rooted for them to take everything, burn down the house and leave the kid in the cold of winter. This movie makes the emoji movie look like a cinematic masterpiece.

)
An Absolute horrible movie!!! Ruined a classic  series and is a disgrace to the series upon which it is based.

Home Sweet Home Alone doesn't feel as great as the other Home Alone movies that came before it. Some scenes in the film are somewhat amusing, but mainly the plot doesn't make much sense. SPOILERS. The "booby trap" setup scene felt unrealistic and too sped up. It is difficult for the audience to tell what traps were set up and how they worked. Also, the motive for breaking into Max's house was borderline absurd compared to a robbery (which was the motive in the original movie). Why not just talk it out to resolve the misunderstanding? The couple just simply thought that Max stole their antique doll and want it back. These people don't have evil intentions, and just try to talk it out with Max. Why are they met with painful "traps?" Perhaps, if criminals tried to steal from a house, these traps would be more suitable.
Absolutely awful. They actually tried to ruin Home Alone. Can't believe this was made…
It takes deliberate effort to make a movie this bad.
Awful. Like why are we supposed to root for this stupid kid? These people just want their doll back. What a ridiculous plot. Lol

All that oddity to create this movie. A single 2 second scene at the beginning would have made this enjoyable. whodunnit???? Without it the whole movie is just so cringey. Bad writing and the writers make me hate the kid and root for the down and out parents that just really want to save their home.

Terrible! The whole thing with the kid and the couple is a massive miss understanding. 
The originals were fun because it was against criminals! The couple aren't criminals they just desperate people who make completely idiotic choices. That make them
Turn into criminals! 
It is a mega stupid plot…
Bad bad bad,horrible i dont know who idea was to make such a bad movie and ruin the classic,they bring back buzz mcallister and that did not save this movie

Trying to piggyback on original movie's success. The "villians" are dumb beyond belief and they want me to cheer for the jerk fat kid who stole their property. I stopped paying attention near the end.
It was a really cute movie! A nice twist with some cute nods to the original.

Empires review nailed it: "The problem is that, if the thieves aren't horrible, the traps feel sadistic instead of satisfying. There's no pleasure in seeing a basically nice person having their feet flambéed, or being hit in the face with increasingly heavy objects, by an entitled rich kid."
The og home alone is better then the new home alone it was skip it

To be honest, this isn't nearly as bad as it's been cracked up to be, usually a movie with these scores would be awful. but I don't see the big issue. It isn't great, but the actors were all decent, and while it was similar to the original, it wasn't just a copy and paste.
Your kids and family will enjoy a few laughs reminiscent of the original, but not one of the best films ever.
A 6th sequel is way too many! Bottom line: Kids will like it because of the slapstick violence. Adults will hate it. Disney should have known better
It wasn't as bad as the 30+ YO critics thought. Nothing will beat the first but come on, it's 2021 doing a late 80s early 90s remake.

What did I just watch?! Surely by now Disney+ must realise no one with any sense of human goodness is going to want to put themselves in as much pain as to watching this movie! Why is Max (the main protagonist) such a loathsome, spoiled brat? (nothing against Archie Yates, he's great, just not in this) I was only five minutes in and was already rooting for the bad guys, despite not knowing who they actually were. Besides the ridiculous plot and the hilariously awful script there's the acting, ninety minutes of torture, watching the actors stumble blindly through each line! 
And the moral of the story? Pick on people less fortunate than you, lie, steal, cheat, IT MAKES NO SENSE!
Disappointing.

First and foremost, I hated this movie during the entire I watched it. The acting, music, editing, casting, and concepts were way off and made it hard to watch. The animation for certain segments looked like were from a Spy Kids movie rip-off. None of the characters were likeable, and I didn't feel compelled to root for any of them - not even the kid, who was just an annoying British brat who seemed like he wanted to genuinely kill the "burglars." The entire concept of the movie with the two families clashes and and doesn't make any sense together. It seems like one of the last things you'd think of making for a Christmas movie, much less a Home Alone type movie. The "pranks" try to be comical with the physics but some of them contrast that by being incredibly violent, beyond pg-movie reasoning. Everything feels off-pace and unnecessary.

Overall, if you're into slapstick comedy and movies that are so bad that they make you laugh, you might be able to get into this one. For a Home Alone movie, it greatly disappoints.

I dove into this movie with zero expectations and came out disappointed. This movie is home alone in name only. It seems they tried to copy aspects of the original yet failed miserably . It's quite possibly one of the worst movies I've ever seen.
watched this with my 10 year old twins.  after 50 minutes one of them finally blurts out "I have no idea who the bad guys are."  pretty much sums up the movie.  so much talent gone to waste!

We were very shocked with how much it made us laugh! It was cheesy and felt like a low budget movie, but it made us all laugh out loud many times. Adrian said it's his favorite Christmas movie of all time now lol

Looking for ways to ruin a franchise look no further than here.  The characters are just fleshed out and they reconcile in the end is this what we came too? The slapstick action is not right and the morale of the story is forced.  Watch the 1990 and 1992 Home Alone it's more entertaining than this.

This is a complete embarrassment to the Home Alone movies. It's full of jokes and references that will get old in a few years, not to say that they're any good currently. The only funny joke was when a character was self aware and made fun of movie remakes. Some scenes look like they're filmed on a phone, and with all these obvious and tacky product placement, they might as well be.

Moving on from the actual film itself, the characters are HORRID. The little 10 year old protagonist is a jerk, and nothing about him is likeable. From this point forward I would put a spoiler warning, but who in their right mind would actually care about a spoiler for this movie? Anyway, he steals an heirloom doll from a family and hides it away in his mansion. This family is struggling to afford their current house, and decide to sell that doll for a lot on eBay to be able to support themselves financially. In their attempts to get into the house to get the doll back, the parents of that family become the classic Home Alone Robbers™. In the end, it turns out the parents' nephew hid the doll away, and all the assault and injuries were for nothing. Long story short, some bratty British kid beats up some people because they're trying to take back what's rightfully theirs. The parents aren't all in the good either, they planned on selling their house but never told their kids about it until they had to explain why they broke into a child's house.

The main difference that makes these characters so unlikeable is that compared to the original Home Alone movies, barely any actions were justified. The British kid (can't bother to remember his name) is a greedy privileged brat who feels no remorse when it comes to stealing a water gun, compared to Kevin who names himself a criminal after stealing a toothbrush. While both these kids attacked the robbers with house traps, the difference is that one pair of robbers has the intent to steal all the valuables from a house a kill a kid, while the other robbers are just trying to retrieve a family heirloom.

TL;DR: Home Sweet Home Alone was so terrible that I was driven to make a Rotten Tomatoes account. Everything from the characters to the camera angles are tacky. The only funny parts were the times when I laughed at how dumb it was. I would only recommend watching if you like making fun of movies with your friends.

This is one of the many movies in which you find yourself rooting for the "villains". The only problem with this one, in particular, is that the "villains" go through gruesome slapstick that is painful to watch.
This movie actually made you root for the people trying to rob the house. The kid is very unlikable, and the parents trying to get the doll back are the sympathetic characters.

I only setup an account here so I could forewarn people just how awful this movie is. I can respect actors taking on roles for nothing else than a paycheck, but this one had to be hard for these folks to swallow. Even my kids were "meh" about it, and would rather watch the two original films. It was so bad, that halfway through I was praying for the internet to go out. It didn't, so I went and flossed instead. Yeah, it was that bad.
I found it entertaining enough.  The 'wisdom of the crowd' seems a bit harsh on this.  Just some holiday silliness.

I hated just about every second of this "movie". It appears as if they didn't send it to a test audience first. This performance made me hate Archie Yates, he is the epitome of awful in this "movie". There are no redeeming qualities and I only have one wish for Christmas, and it's that this movie gets unreleased and is somehow erased from my memory.
i don't know why people didn't like it

I honestly don't understand the hate for this movie in the ratings. While nothing could compare to the original, I felt like this was a respectful homage and was entertaining and well-made, probably the best in the series outside of the first two, probably because John Hughes was involved. It probably isn't worthy of my 5-star rating, but I think it is WAY better than a 1-star, so this negates one of those anyway! My family loved it, and the kids have watched it several times already!
just doesn't hit like the other home alones. ruined it completely
Tedious and unfunny homage to the original 1990 movie.

Calling shenanigans.  So this is about a married couple (Ellie Kemper, Rob Delaney).  They get put in a position where they have no choice but to sell their home but realize that a creepy doll with an upside-down face that they had in storage may be worth hundreds of thousands of dollars.  The only trouble is that before they have this epiphany, a little brat (Archie Yates) may have lifted the doll during an open house.  They've got to steal it back, and how hard can that be when the kid's family has left him home alone on their Tokyo vacation?  Like taking candy from a baby, right?  Now I can't lie here: I watched this with basement level expectations.  I think the first Home Alone is just fine for what it is, but the second is just a glorified remake, and I never even took the time with 3, 4, or 5 (yes, I'm counting the TV movie).  I can't speak for the other sequels, but I'm having difficulty imagining them stooping lower than Home Sweet Home Alone.  I don't even know how to review this movie.  It's broken up into thirds with defining acts if you're looking to digest it in thirty-minute blocks instead of just one go.  The first third is setting up this wacky scenario that could be solved with a simple conversation.  The second third is the recon stage where this married couple showcases that they would be maimed by incompetence even if a bloodthirsty child wasn't in the equation.  The finale, as you can already guess, is all of the traps.  The setup isn't great, but it isn't offensive.  It sets the expectation that I wasn't going to get any laughs, but at least it doesn't pretend like we are here for something else.  There is not a likable character in sight, and that is what I think this movie's biggest downfall is.  You understand the situation this married couple is in, and I've enjoyed Kemper and Delaney in the past, but goodwill will only get you so far.  These two characters are both schlubs, and neither have a redeeming quality about them.  This would be fine if you wanted to root for the kid, but he is also equally terrible.  I don't like to come down hard on child actors, but Archie Yates is no Macaulay Culkin, and this is not a kid you want to spend your time around.  I spent the majority of this movie looking for something nice to say about it, and I've got nothing.  They got the same actor back that played Buzz for a cameo scene if that is important to you, but everything about this just screams cash-grab.  I feel like this could have potentially made me angrier, but that hardly can be counted as praise.  I never found a moment to make me laugh, and you should actively avoid this.
The sad part was the robbers weren't even bad

Better than it has a right to be, this film has a lot of good potential but it doesn't know how to hit the right notes. Casting Elle Kemper from The Office to play a anti villain is a good idea but we also have to show empathy for the main protagonist too, who is a snotty brat at the start and his transition to becoming a better person is handled sloppy. Sure, while this child actor is better than the ones from Daddys Home and gets more screen time, the transition to the kid learning his lesson, isn't earned because before the transition, the kid is a spoiled brat that is more laughable than relatable. Sure, kids will see that how the protagonist acts in the beginning is wrong, adults might find this kid repulsive. Personally, I don't know why the hell the kid hero is english. Its Home Alone. Not Horrid Henry. Overall, a clumsy movie but its almost so bad its good which is good enough for me
The end makes the movie worth it.
Made account just to give this film lowest score possible. REALLY BAD!
This is so bad, can't even bear to finish it. The little boy is the thief and trying to justify child stealing stuff is actually disgusting.

I made an account solely to leave a review on this movie. It was so genuinely bad, and should be even remotely related to the original films. The writers managed to make you care and relate more to the "bad guys" of the film than the kid. Jeff and Pam are more likeable, relatable, and get way more screen time than the supposed main character, Max. I seriously feel that middle school students could write a better script than this. How did this ever get past pre-production?

The only real compliment I can give "Home Sweet Home Alone" is that I don't hate it quite as much as "Home Alone 4." That being said, it is still an awful movie in almost every way. I thought some of the jokes here and then were amusing and sure there are some fun references. However, the story is spectacularly awful here. Any real fan of the original "Home Alone" movies (for me these are the first three) will see that this movie doesn't come remotely close. It's one of those franchises that work the best with the 90s charm and this movie was boring and the slapstick felt uninspired. Maybe young kids will find enjoyment in it, but I don't know why anyone would show this to their kids when they could just watch one of the first two, which are still a total blast, and blow this horrendous movie out of the water.

I really had mixed feelings throughout. It was a cute diversion that families could watch together, but I think the writers and the director really missed the boat in where our sympathies should lie. The kid was utterly obnoxious (not the actors fault) and impossible to root for. The husband and wife were actually the good guys and yet we are supposed to enjoy seeing them demeaned and beat up? In the end, even though the movie is family-friendly, it sends an absolutely terrible message to any kids that watch it.

Casting: the star is an unlikable lump with a bad haircut, and a bratty attitude.  The test of the cast was so unmemorable that I have nothing to say about them.
Plot: The guy could have easily grabbed what he thought to be his missing doll the first time he unlocked the door, before the cops arrived. He chose not to. 
They didn't need to sell to their house if the dad had just gotten any job while looking for a good career job replacement. He chose not to.
The husband and wife could have knocked on the door to ask about the missing doll, or called the police, instead of breaking in. They chose not to.
(Spoiler alert!!) There was no plot point at all, we find out. The doll was in the house the whole time. The fat, ill-behaved kid became friends with the people who could have rang the doorbell to ask about the doll instead of destroying his home. The mom came home. All is well. There was a simple misunderstanding, no real conflict. The battle between adults and kid was so far from needing to happen, but the producers didn't care - they just needed to milk to the cash cow a little more.
I was generous with the extra half star on account of Buzz's role.
Beer, subway, and low expectations are not enough to make you believe that this deserves a half star.
Absolutely terrible.
Unbearably rubbish! Awful cast and ridiculous storyline! Half a star is generous

I would love to give this ZERO STARS!!!!! The most physical pain and torture I've endured while watching a movie. The kid actor was meh but the script was so purely garbage (like worse than CW Flash) I found myself more sympathetic towards the "villains" of the film, and in-turn lead to strong emotions of hatred and anger towards Archie Yates's character. Disney's futile attempt to cash in on the franchise's original charm and nostalgia came off as lazy and had no real affect on me personally as it was too painful to bare. I wish the kid actor didn't have any part in this film as it has inadvertently made me despise him in any and all future films. I cannot express the sheer amount of agony I'm feeling right now due to Home Sweet Home Alone. There are absolutely no positives to this movie except some decently funny jokes. 4% Overall.

3/5.  Better than the 4th and 5th films, this movie actually has a fun twist on the formula, some insanely violent traps, and a fun 3rd act.  The middle of the movie is dull and there are too many references to the original film, but this is a fine movie if nothing spectacular.

[⭐️43%]

Home Sweet Home Alone (2021) delivers yet another unnecessary film into this franchise, however this time with a solid cast. With big name actors like Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney, it is expected that they will get a lot of screen time, and while they play their roles to the best of their ability, the amount of development given to them over Archie Yates' character is one of the reasons this film doesn't work. All of the Home Alone sequels are a rehash of the original, all containing a child-focused story about people trying to break into his house with a massive showdown at the end with traps, and while Home Sweet Home Alone (2021) contains the latter two, it doesn't trust Archie Yates' enough to be the lead of this film, despite him showing in Jojo Rabbit (2019) and in his little screen time here that he has a fun charisma. And with the focus more on the adult characters it tackles some adult themes like financial struggles which won't really appeal to its young target audience.

The attempts at humour are dumb and unfunny, which would be fine if everything else was targeted towards kids, however there were too many plot holes and bad character decisions to look the other way.

Home Sweet Home Alone (2021) proves that not every popular movie needs a sequel, and definitely not five sequels.

Seriously Disney? Where is your head on tradition and family and Christmas joy? Bah humbug.

I was fully expecting to find this movie terrible, but I actually liked it. Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney were really funny, it was cute and silly, and the role inversion was clever. It's not going to win an Oscar but that's not why it's aiming for. It's a fun, Sunday night daily movie and worth taking the time to enjoy for what it is.

This movie is truly as horrendous as you've heard. The jokes skew older while the pratfalls skew younger. There are some very funny people in this movie who have done very funny shows and movies but almost nothing in this movie lands. It humanizes the burglars to the point where you want to root for them to outsmart their sociopathic adversary. In fact, there is no point in this movie that recreates the sense of peril faced by Kevin in the originals. And the whole reason you watch one of these movies, the trap sequence, is only about five minutes long and isn't super imaginative. One good thing I'll say is that the movie borrows liberally from John Williams' scores for the first two films, but hearing that music will only stir up memories and nostalgia for far more engaging films.

Almost painful to watch. I loved the original but this one sucked. The kids character is one you want to stick in the corner for a permanent time out and you actually feel sorry for the couple. It's not funny and the acting is terrible all around. Waste of time.

Spoiler: In this version of Home Alone, the kid is an absolute POS and the "robbers" are trying to get their own property back, that they think the kid stole. They want to save their house from forced sale and you want them to kill the kid. It lacks all the fun of the first two movies. There are also these weird, grotesque side characters, like the cop or guy on the plane seated next to the mom as she tries to get home, that contribute to the overall terribleness of this movie. Skip this one.
I didn't think it could get any worse, but it does.
Don't bother... the first two were sooo much better.
Pathetic excuse for a movie.

This movie was horrible. It was a terrible attempt at a remake of a classic movie. The acting was terrible, especially by the two "bad guys" and the "kid." You can't help but feel bad for the "bad guys" who are really two parents who are down on the luck. The only redeeming part is the ending when the misunderstanding was revealed. Sorry, producers, you should have left the original alone.
You can see the effort that 'Home Sweet, Home Alone' tries to have and the great role of Archie Yates, But what seems like a sweet home, is an impossible place to live there

No main character is anyway likeable, especially the main kid he is irritating to watch. 
The acting is terrible. Comedy is forced. This movie should have never been made. Terrible movie
very bad.....not much to say except for DONT WATCH IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The most mean spirited Christmas and Home alone film ever! When you're rooting against the kid then you know the writers screwed up.

Some people think Home alone 2 is bad and Many say Home Alone 3 is bad but I don't even know how you can dislike those two films after seeing Home Alone get put through the wringer all these years later. 2 played it safe and fun, 3 tried something new and fun, 4-HSHA are just desperate unfunny and sometimes mean spirited cash in's.
Go rewatch 1-3 to entertain yourself this Holiday Season
This is a crime of nature
